messages: b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (10:59): 414 is Request-URI Too Long
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (10:59): hrm. eenteresting
aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990 (10:59): hey folks, can anyone recommend a decent way to get virtual hosting with apache, without the need to constantly edit my virtual hosts config file?

aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990 (11:00): I've thought about either using a database (but not sure which module from the many aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990ailable is best), or some kind of mod_rewrite rule, but i'd like to keep seperate log files for each vhost
aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990 (11:00): also concerned with performance from using mod_rewrite
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (11:02): mass vhosts is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/vhosts/mass.html
4f8dc60f261d2b7b4c52c15cd5ccd177 (11:02): heh, old but...funny http://www.linuxkungfu.org/images/fun/geek/project.jpg
aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990 (11:03): thanks :)
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:06): Is it absolutely necessary for me to have SP1 if I want to get Apache 2.2.2 running on Windows?
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:07): And the thing is totally behind a NAT router
16792d15bb74f08e6c86e54246cc65e3 (11:07): shrug, good idea to be up to date anyway.
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:07): so only port 80 is forwarded to the webserver
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:08): Well the thing is ... I downloaded Win32 2.2.2 binaries from apachelounge.com
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:08): and it say the configuration is not correct or something
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:08): I was wondering if that is because I don't have SP1
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:09): I have all single updates though :P
aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990 (11:10): Mofoya: it might be because your configuration is not correct :)
16792d15bb74f08e6c86e54246cc65e3 (11:10): check what the error message is.
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:10): gah just got rid of it
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:10): Umm it gave the same error for httpd as well
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:12): btw, is there some exploit for Windows TCP stack before SP1 or something?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:12): mofoya: http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/#problems
aac1259dfa2c6c5ead508f34e52bb990 (11:12): Mofoya: ask microsoft :)
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:13): I have all the SP1 and SP2 single fixes
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:13): btw, MS no longer supports RTM; and SP2 has general improvements in the network stack.
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:13): mofoya: then read that MSKB article linked to
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:13): from the download page
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:14): If I only wasn't bugged down to run Windows
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:14): you may need to scroll up or down a bit to find the SP1 FAQ
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:14): I'd remove these all in 1 minute
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:14): install knoppix
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:14): and breathe easier
16792d15bb74f08e6c86e54246cc65e3 (11:14): get another machine
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:14): Heh my mom brought me a new box =D
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:15): down from the trashing area in our apt.

c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:15): huh. from the MSKB article: "There have been reports that this issue affects users running Apache Server 1.3.24 or 2.0 Beta. For more information, please visit the following Apache Web site: "
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:15): of course the site tells you to download SP1 and to read that KB article
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:15): they bounce you back and forth
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:15): MS <--> Apache Foundation
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:16): at least they both tell you to install SP1 or newer
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:16): no confliciting answers there

d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:21): No windows error
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:21): including the event viewer?
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:21): I'm working on httpd.conf
d643b8cd2a351de1052ab81a40360665 (11:22): give me a minute
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:22): touching httpd.conf is premature.
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (11:22): also, note that SP1 is explicitly required as noted on the download page
